Definitions.Paraphrase:
any day except Sunday and Saturday
工作日（星期六、日以外的日子）
That store opens only on weekdays.
这商店只在工作日营业。

make a short, sharp sound
发出"嘟"、"咔嗒"等轻微响声
The key clicked in the lock.
钥匙在琐里"咔嗒"响了一声。

a short, sharp sound
咔嗒声
The door opened with a click.
门"咔嗒"一声开了。

1. make a sudden, loud sound
发出猛烈响声
As she entered the room, the sound of western music blasted forth.
她进房间时，猛地响起了西部音乐。
2. break up by explosion
爆破
They blasted a hole in the wall so that they could get through. 
他们在墙上炸了一个洞以进入屋内。
3. attack with explosives
以炸药攻击
The soldiers blasted the stronghold.
战士们用炸药炸碉堡。

out; forward
出来; 向前
The sun came forth from behind the clouds.
太阳从云层里出来。

shocking, frightening; unpleasant
可怕的；令人不悦的
What a horrible mistake you've made!
你犯了个多么可怕的错误！

matter; material
东西；材料
He put some kind of stuff on his leg.
他往腿上涂了些什么东西。
Let's pick up this stuff before we go.
咱们走前把这东西带上。

regular repeated pattern of sounds or movements
节奏; 韵律
That music has a strong rhythm.
这音乐的节奏感很强。
The rhythm of moving a baby's bed can help make a baby sleep.
摇动婴儿床的节奏能帮助婴儿入睡。

strange; unusual
古怪的；离奇的
The weird cries are from the woods. 
这怪叫声是从树林里传过来的。

certainly; with no doubt
当然；无疑地
Has he got the job he wanted? 
他得到了他申请的工作吗？
Definitely.
当然。

1. full of force 
有力的，强壮的
His arms are powerful.
他的双臂强壮有力。
2. having a strong effect
功效大的
His speech is powerful.
他的讲话很有说服力。
These drugs are powerful.
这些药物很有效。

young person
青少年; 青年

a person who is able in music
音乐师
This music group has four musicians, two men and two women.
这个乐队有四名音乐师，两名男的,两名女的。

1. very unpleasant
极讨厌的，令人作呕的
He did something offensive to annoy her.
他做了件令人讨厌的事，令她很生气。
2. for attacking 
攻击性的
That country developed lots of offensive guns.
那个国家研制了许多进攻性武器。

1. interrupt, trouble or bother 
打扰, 妨碍
Sorry to disturb you, but I want to speak to Mr. John.
对不起，打搅你了，我想跟约翰先生说几句话。
2. make sb. worried or unhappy 
使不安，使烦恼
They were rather disturbed by the way the government tried to cover the truth.
他们对于政府掩盖真相的做法感到不安。

take suddenly and roughly 
抓取，攫取
She grabbed the book and went off for school.
她抓起书就上学校去了。

1. complete in every way
彻底的
The police made a thorough search of the room. 
警察彻底地搜查了这房间。
2. careful about details
认真的
He made a thorough study of the story. 
他认真地研究了这篇短篇小说。

carefully; completely
仔细地；彻底地

(cause to) hit hard and with loud noises 
（使）撞击；（使）猛击, 使劲敲
He banged on the door.
他"砰砰"地敲门。

hurry
催促；赶
The police hustled the crowds away.
警察把人群赶走了。

a piece of special cloth for drying things
毛巾

an informal, cotton article of clothing
圆领衫

strong cotton trousers
牛仔裤

cover in material that is folded over
包，裹
Please wrap the box in red paper. 
请用红纸将盒子包起来。
The gifts were wrapped in pretty paper.
礼品是用漂亮的包装纸包着的。

(woolen) clothing for the top part of the body
（羊）毛衣

paint, powder, etc., worn on the face
化妆品

bread made brown by heating
烤面包

1. an object for producing musical sounds
乐器
Both the violin and the piano are instruments.
小提琴和钢琴都是乐器。
2. a tool
工具
A hammer is an instrument people often use for repairing things.
锤子是人们常用来修理东西的工具。

(informal/slang) yes
表示讨厌、嘲笑、无耐心等发出的惊叹语

cause not to  like
使厌恶，使反感
The smell of the bad egg disgusts me.
这变质了的蛋的气味令我作呕。

very unpleasant 
令人厌恶的，令人作呕的
The bad egg has a disgusting smell.
这个蛋变质了，味道很难闻。

woman's shirt
女衬衫

a box built into the wall to store things
壁柜

(informal/slang) bother; annoy; trouble
令人生气；使人烦； 纠缠
I did it only to bug my colleagues.
我做这事只是想跟我的同事过不去。

dark make-up lines around the lashes or the pencil for making lines around the eyes or in the eye-brows
眼线（笔）

make a little angry
使生气; 使恼怒
His coming late annoys his boss.
他的迟到令老板生气。

patterns made by putting paint into the skin
纹身

make a hole in
穿洞; 刺穿，刺破
Oh, you are wearing ear rings! When did you have your ears pierced?
哦，你戴耳环了！是什么时候穿的耳朵？

suddenly start to run or break away 
冲出去，逃跑
The horse bolted at the sight of the car.
马见到汽车就奔跑了起来。
闩，拴住

Definitions.PartofSpeech:
(sounds) come out suddenly 
（声音）突然响起来
As she turns on the radio, music blasts forth.
她一打开收音机，音乐就响了起来。

in company with; together with 
一道
I'll go along with you. 
我和你一道去。
There was a bill along with the packet. 
邮包里还附有一份账单。

stop; change to off 
关
Turn off the light before you leave the room.
离开房间前请把灯关上。

1. enter hurriedly, often with force
匆匆进入
The children burst into the room for toys.
孩子们冲进房间拿玩具。
2. start suddenly
突然爆发
She burst into laughing at the wrong time.
她不合时宜地突然笑了起来。

again and again; regularly 
一次次
Read the word over and over until you know it.
反复读这个单词，直到你读对了为止。
I have told them over and over again, they should know what to do. 
我跟他们说了好多次了，他们应该知道该做什么。

move one's hand so as to touch or hold sth.
伸手去抓
There was no time for me to reach for my gun.
我没有时间伸手拿枪。

increase the volume/size of (sound, flame, etc.) 
增大（声音、火焰等）
He turned up the radio so that everybody could hear it.
他把收音机的声音放大，这样人人都听得到。

reduce (sound, flame, etc.) usually by moving a switch
减小（声音、火焰等）
Please turn the radio down. I'm trying to sleep.
请把收音机关小点，我想睡觉了。

and; in addition to 
和，以及，还有
He was kind as well as handsome.
他既英俊又善良。

as is common; as has happened before
与往常一样
As usual, Sandy's music made her father's stomach feel ill.
与往常一样，桑迪的音乐使她爸爸忧虑不安。

change to on, cause to flow or operate
开，打开
Please turn on the light for me, it's getting dark.
天黑了，请给我打开灯。

(informal) so much; to such a degree
那么...... 
I didn't know you cared that much.
我不知道你那么在乎。
I like him but not that much.
我喜欢他，但不至于到那种程度。

leave in a sudden or unexpected hurry
匆匆离开
When I opened the door, the cat bolted out. 
我打开门时，一只猫窜了出来。
绿浪(作者为故事杜撰的名字。)
